search_results.query: How to go from New York to Montreal

snippet.title:
Photo Location Guide: An Unconventional Way to Photograph New York Living in Eastern Canada (Montreal) near the US border has a big advantage for any travel photographer or photo enthusiast; it puts you within driving distance of two beautiful and extremely photogenic cities; Boston, and New York
I have a tradition where I visit New York at least once a year. Even if I have happened to visit during my business trips, I still try to find time to return on my own. Since I am not a winter person, and I do not enjoy outdoor photography in wintertime, most of my visits to New York have been in the summer.
It is not easy to photograph New York in the middle of summer. Any place you go is full of tourists, and sometimes it is not easy to frame an interesting shot without people in it ...
Find complete article with the map and photos http://goo.gl/rjWFgH﻿

Fall colours - Amtrak Montreal to New York
Great sites in the fall via Amtrak Montreal to New York. This is shot from our window seat on the train. I enjoy the train for comfortability and convenience over flying. At least I haven't had my private parts patted down taking the train.﻿
Meer weergevenMinder weergeven

The New York, Boston & Montreal was a victim of the Panic of 1873. They were going to connect New York to Boston by using some existing railroads, and building some connector lines. This cut was east of Carmel, NY, and was to carry the traffic north from the Putnam Branch. They built some culverts nearby, and some fills, but the longest single piece I found was only about 200' long.
That seems to be the pattern when building a railroad. You don't just start at one end and keep building out. You start at multiple ends, build pieces and connect them all together. Or, in this case, if you've run out of money, not connect them together.﻿

Old Town, Montreal. Filled with brick streets.
Montreal and New York are two great places to visit to take photography. Lots to see and explore. I am going through a whack of photos that I took about a year ago. Makes me want to go back, that and I really want to go back and see my daughter.﻿

For all you East Coasters Especially for the +New England Patriots ( GO PATS ) and +New York Giants fans on this Super Bowl weekend a shot of home from the ISS.
This Jan. 29 panorama of much of the East Coast, photographed by one of the Expedition 30 crew members aboard the International Space Station, provides a look generally northeastward: Philadelphia-New York City-Boston corridor (bottom-center); western Lake Ontario shoreline with Toronto (left edge); Montreal (near center). An optical illusion in the photo makes the atmospheric limb and light activity from Aurora Borealis appear "intertwined." Image Credit: NASA﻿
